static CHAR array []

Detailed Description

TestWriter class is used to output state information used by APOXI Tester. The method-calls are delegated to the class Tracer, which performs the actual output. Methods of TestWriter should never be called directly. Use the macro WRITE_STATE instead.

Member Enumeration Documentation

anonymous enum
 

Enumeration containing all defined types of states. If additional states shall be used, this enumeration has to be extended.

Member Function Documentation

void TestWriter::WriteCoverageBuffer (   )  [static]
 

void TestWriter::WriteState (  UINT16  eventId,
const WCHAR *  value = L"",
  ...
)  [static]
 

The second WriteState method only differs in the datatype of the second parameter. Whereas the first method is used with CHAR* strings, this method takes a WCHAR* string as value.

void TestWriter::WriteState (  UINT16  eventId,
const CHAR *  value = "",
  ...
)  [static]
 

WriteState writes a state to the default output media. The output media depends on the used platform and is predefined in the class Tracer

Parameters:
eventId Specifies the kind of state to output. The value of eventId must be one of the values defined in the enumeration below.
value A string representing the value of the state. Additionally, you can add a variable number of parameters to be include into the value string (same behaviour as printf). If this parameter is left blank, an empty string is used.
